009
010package imagingbook.spectral.dct;
011
012/**
013 * <p>
014 * Common interface for all two-dimensional DCT implementations.
015 * Based on associated one-dimensional DCT methods (see {@link Dct1d}).
016 * See Ch. 20 of [1] for additional details.
017 * </p>
018 * <p>
019 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
020 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
021 * </p>
022 * 
023 * @author WB
024 * @version 2022/10/21
025 * @see Dct1d
026 */
027public interface Dct2d {
028        
029        public int getWidth();
030        public int getHeight();
031        
032        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
033
034        public interface Float extends Dct2d {
035                
036                /**
037                 * Returns a suitable 1D DCT of the specified size ({@code float}).
038                 * @param size the size of the DCT
039                 * @return a {@link Dct1d.Float} instance
040                 */
041                public Dct1d.Float get1dDct(int size);
042                
043                /**
044                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DCT forward transformation on the supplied data.
045                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DCT spectrum.
046                 * @param g the signal to be transformed (modified)
047                 */
048                public default void forward(float[][] g) {
049                        transform(g, true);
050                }
051
052                /**
053                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DCT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
054                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
055                 * @param G the spectrum to be transformed (modified)
056                 */
057                public default void inverse(float[][] G) {
058                        transform(G, false);
059                }
060
061                /**
062                 * Transforms the given 2D array 'in-place'.
063                 * 
064                 * @param data the input signal or spectrum (modified)
065                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
066                 */
067                default void transform(final float[][] data, boolean forward) {
068                        checkSize(data);
069                        final int width = data.length;
070                        final int height = data[0].length;
071
072                        // do the rows:
073                        float[] row = new float[width];
074                        Dct1d.Float dct1R = get1dDct(width);
075                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
076                                extractRow(data, v, row);
077                                if (forward)
078                                        dct1R.forward(row);
079                                else
080                                        dct1R.inverse(row);
081                                insertRow(data, v, row);
082                        }
083
084                        // do the columns:
085                        float[] col = new float[height];
086                        Dct1d.Float dct1C = get1dDct(height);
087                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
088                                extractCol(data, u, col);
089                                if (forward)
090                                        dct1C.forward(col);
091                                else
092                                        dct1C.inverse(col);
093                                insertCol(data, u, col);
094                        }
095                }
096
097                default void extractRow(float[][] data, int v, float[] row) {
098                        final int width = data.length;
099                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
100                                row[u] = data[u][v];
101                        }
102                }
103
104                default void insertRow(float[][] data, int v, float[] row) {
105                        final int width = data.length;
106                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
107                                data[u][v] = row[u];
108                        }
109                }
110
111                default void extractCol(float[][] data, int u, float[] column) {
112                        final int height = data[0].length;
113                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
114                                column[v] = data[u][v];
115                        }
116                }
117
118                default void insertCol(float[][] data, int u, float[] column) {
119                        final int height = data[0].length;
120                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
121                                data[u][v] = column[v];
122                        }
123                }
124                
125                public default void checkSize(float[][] A) {
126                        if (A.length != this.getWidth()) 
127                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
128                                                String.format("wrong 2D array width %d (expected %d)", A.length, this.getWidth()));
129                        if (A[0].length != this.getHeight()) 
130                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
131                                                String.format("wrong 2D array height %d (expected %d)", A[0].length, this.getHeight()));
132                }
133                
134        }
135        
136        public interface Double extends Dct2d {
137                
138                /**
139                 * Returns a suitable 1D DCT of the specified size ({@code double}).
140                 * @param size the size of the DCT
141                 * @return a {@link Dct1d.Double} instance
142                 */
143                public Dct1d.Double get1dDct(int size);
144                
145                /**
146                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DCT forward transformation on the supplied data.
147                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DCT spectrum.
148                 * @param g the signal to be transformed (modified)
149                 */
150                public default void forward(double[][] g) {
151                        transform(g, true);
152                }
153
154                /**
155                 * Performs an "in-place" 2D DCT inverse transformation on the supplied spectrum.
156                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
157                 * @param G the spectrum to be transformed (modified)
158                 */
159                public default void inverse(double[][] G) {
160                        transform(G, false);
161                }
162                
163                /**
164                 * Transforms the given 2D array 'in-place'.
165                 * 
166                 * @param data the input signal or spectrum (modified)
167                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
168                 */
169                default void transform(final double[][] data, boolean forward) {
170                        checkSize(data);
171                        final int width = data.length;
172                        final int height = data[0].length;
173
174                        // do the rows:
175                        double[] row = new double[width];
176                        Dct1d.Double dct1R = get1dDct(width);
177                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
178                                extractRow(data, v, row);
179                                if (forward)
180                                        dct1R.forward(row);
181                                else
182                                        dct1R.inverse(row);
183                                insertRow(data, v, row);
184                        }
185
186                        // do the columns:
187                        double[] col = new double[height];
188                        Dct1d.Double dct1C = get1dDct(height);
189                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
190                                extractCol(data, u, col);
191                                if (forward)
192                                        dct1C.forward(col);
193                                else
194                                        dct1C.inverse(col);
195                                insertCol(data, u, col);
196                        }
197                }
198                
199                default void extractRow(double[][] data, int v, double[] row) {
200                        final int width = data.length;
201                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
202                                row[u] = data[u][v];
203                        }
204                }
205
206                default void insertRow(double[][] data, int v, double[] row) {
207                        final int width = data.length;
208                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
209                                data[u][v] = row[u];
210                        }
211                }
212
213                default void extractCol(double[][] data, int u, double[] column) {
214                        final int height = data[0].length;
215                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
216                                column[v] = data[u][v];
217                        }
218                }
219
220                default void insertCol(double[][] data, int u, double[] column) {
221                        final int height = data[0].length;
222                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
223                                data[u][v] = column[v];
224                        }
225                }
226                
227                public default void checkSize(double[][] A) {
228                        if (A.length != this.getWidth()) 
229                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
230                                                String.format("wrong 2D array width %d (expected %d)", A.length, this.getWidth()));
231                        if (A[0].length != this.getHeight()) 
232                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
233                                                String.format("wrong 2D array height %d (expected %d)", A[0].length, this.getHeight()));
234                }
235                
236        }
237
238}
